title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: The article emphasizes the importance of recycling as a method to reduce waste, conserve natural resources, and mitigate environmental impacts, highlighting its economic and social advantages. It discusses the benefits of recycling various materials, including plastics, metals, and paper, while promoting a cultural shift toward reducing and reusing resources to achieve sustainability. Overall, it advocates for recycling as a core component of environmental responsibility and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses recycling processes that significantly reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability by minimizing waste and conserving resources.
business_innovation: FALSE, because the article does not identify a specific new or improved product or business process introduced on the market by a firm.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not specify a particular good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE, because the article outlines recycling as a process that minimizes environmental impacts, conserves natural resources, and reduces energy consumption.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities;  recycling facilities; 312120 - Beverage Manufacturing;  recycling ingredients; 423930 - Recyclable Material Merchant Wholesalers; 812321 - Landscaping Services; incorporating recycled materials into landscape architecture.
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article provides factual information about the benefits and processes of recycling, without making misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: FEATURE: "Horizontal recycling" tackling waste and giving plastics 2nd life - Kyodo News Plus
summary: A horizontal recycling initiative in Japan aims to address plastic waste by recovering and processing used products into new items, such as refill packs. Major companies like Kao Corp. and Lion Corp. are collaborating in this project to reduce the need for new petroleum-derived materials, promoting sustainable practices. The project aims to enhance recycling methods by focusing on reusing materials instead of converting them into different products that are often incinerated. Kobe city plans to increase its collection of refill packs to achieve its recycling goals ahead of schedule.
green_innovation: TRUE - This initiative promotes sustainability by reusing plastic materials through horizontal recycling, significantly reducing environmental impact and waste.
business_innovation: TRUE - The initiative represents an improved business process in recycling, as it innovatively transforms used products back into the same type of products, enhancing operational sustainability.
green_product: TRUE - Refill packs for daily-use products that significantly cut plastic waste and can be recycled into the same product category fit the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The horizontal recycling method employed here minimizes waste and environmental impact by converting used items directly back into similar products without requiring new materials.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325611 - Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not indicate that any misleading claims are being made; instead, it presents a transparent initiative focusing on genuine environmental sustainability efforts.

title: Johnson Controls launches a partnership with Nucor to recycle nearly 100% of scrap steel at major Johnson Controls ... - PR Newswire
summary: Johnson Controls has launched a closed-loop steel recycling partnership with Nucor to recycle nearly 100% of secondary scrap steel at its US facilities, repurposing it as low-embodied-carbon steel. This initiative aims to reduce embodied carbon across their product portfolio and promotes energy-efficient, sustainable practices in steel production. The program reflects Johnson Controls' commitment to sustainability and decarbonization in hard-to-abate sectors like steel. With over 70% of their steel sourced from recycled materials, this approach significantly enhances resource efficiency in the steel supply chain.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is green innovation because it significantly reduces embodied carbon emissions through a closed-loop recycling system, minimizes resource consumption, and promotes sustainability in steel production.
business_innovation: TRUE - This is a business innovation because it represents a new and improved business process for recycling steel that differs from Johnson Controls' previous practices, introducing a significant change in their operations.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not specifically identify a new green product; it focuses on a green process designed to enhance sustainability in steel recycling.
green_process: TRUE - This is a green process as it involves recycling steel using electric arc furnace technology, reducing waste and emissions while promoting sustainability through closed-loop recycling.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331110 - Iron and Steel Mills, 331221 - Iron and Steel Manufacturing from Purchased Steel, 327390 - Other Concrete Product Manufacturing, 561210 - Facilities Support Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not indicate greenwashing, as Johnson Controls is transparently outlining its sustainable practices and commitments towards decarbonization and resource efficiency.

title: GUNPLA (GUNDAM Plastic Models) Recycling Project / METI Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry - meti.go.jp
summary: The GUNPLA Recycling Project, initiated by Bandai Namco Group, aims to recycle plastic model runners into new GUNPLA models, utilizing advanced chemical recycling technology. The project promotes efficient resource recycling through dedicated collection initiatives and partnerships with fans. It emphasizes the importance of plastic waste management in response to global concerns. This innovation seeks to create a sustainable society while engaging a generational fan base in responsible practices.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation because it significantly reduces plastic waste and enhances recycling processes through new technologies, contributing to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation as it introduces a new and improved process of recycling plastic model components, which differs significantly from previous practices and is brought into use by the firm.
green_product: TRUE: This is a green product because the ECOPLA models created from recycled materials minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE: This is a green process as it involves advanced recycling techniques that minimize waste and conserve resources while transforming disposable plastic into new products.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 (Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing), 326199 (All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing), 424990 (Other Miscellaneous Nondurable Goods Merchant Wholesalers), 541614 (Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services)
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not present any misleading information about the environmental benefits of the GUNPLA Recycling Project; it transparently describes genuine efforts to recycle and minimize waste.

title: How yachts are disposed of â€“ and why it's so environmentally toxic - Yachting Monthly
summary: The article highlights the challenges the marine industry faces in disposing of redundant GRP-built craft, emphasizing the urgent need for effective recycling solutions due to the growing volume of fiberglass waste. It discusses various recycling technologies, including mechanical grinding, incineration, co-processing in cement production, pyrolysis, and solvolysis, while emphasizing the financial barriers to scaling these solutions. Additionally, it showcases the APER scheme in France as a successful model for extending producer responsibility and the potential for new bio-based materials to create more sustainable boatbuilding practices. Overall, the article underscores the importance of innovation in addressing environmental impacts associated with the marine industry.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article discusses innovations aimed at recycling and managing environmentally toxic fiberglass waste, contributing to environmental sustainability by reducing negative externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE, as it addresses new methods and processes in the marine industry for recycling and developing bio-based materials, which significantly differ from traditional methods.
green_product: TRUE, the article identifies potential green products such as bio-based materials and natural fibers that have a lower environmental impact and promote sustainability within the marine industry.
green_process: TRUE, because the article outlines several recycling technologies and methods that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability in the disposal of GRP waste.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325991 - Carbon Black Manufacturing; 327993 - Glass Fiber Manufacturing; 486110 - Crude Petroleum Extraction; 811310 - Commercial and Industrial Machinery and Equipment (except Automotive and Electronic) Repair and Maintenance.
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article discusses genuine innovations and efforts to address real environmental issues in the marine industry, rather than misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: Global Black Mass Recycling Market Report 2023: A $52.99 Million Market by 2029 from $9.22 Million in 2022 - A ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The article discusses the significant growth projected for the black mass recycling market, expected to reach approximately $53 billion by 2031. This growth is driven by rising demand for electric vehicles and advancements in recycling technology that facilitate the recovery of essential metals from used lithium-ion batteries. Key players in this market are adapting their strategies to align with circular economy principles and mitigate environmental impacts. Recent investments and partnerships highlight the industry's potential to create economic and environmental benefits.
green_innovation: TRUE: The black mass recycling market contributes to environmental sustainability by recovering valuable metals from used lithium-ion batteries, thus supporting the circular economy and reducing waste.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article describes the emergence and expansion of the black mass recycling market, which represents a new or improved business process developed by companies for reprocessing lithium-ion batteries.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not specifically mention a good or service that fits the comprehensive definition of a green product but focuses on the market and processes for recycling.
green_process: TRUE: The black mass recycling process minimizes environmental impacts by recovering metals from spent lithium-ion batteries, thereby promoting sustainability through resource conservation.
